channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Holy white smoke, the Catholic Church has a new pope!
item.description: White smoke streamed from a chimney atop the Sistine Chapel, signaling to the world that the 133 cardinals inside have elected a new pope. But we don'...

item.title: Americans are already seeing Trump's tariffs kick in. They sent in receipts to prove it
item.description: There's new tariffs on almost everything that is imported. Some of that increased cost is being eaten by exporters in other countries, but a lot of th...

item.title: Medicaid payments barely keep hospital mental health units afloat. Federal cuts could sink them
item.description: Patients seeking mental health care are more likely to be on Medicaid than patients in more profitable areas of care, such as cancer or cardiac treatm...

item.title: How one writer quit dieting and discovered her strength through weightlifting
item.description: Casey Johnston spent years running and restricting calories. When she started weightlifting, she rebuilt muscle mass — and her relationship with her b...

item.title: Former CDC staff warn of "a five alarm fire"
item.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has laid off thousands of workers since January. Current and former CDC staff are grappling with uncert...

item.title: When will the 2025 conclave bring a new pope?
item.description: Catholic cardinals are gathering at the Vatican for the 2025 conclave to choose Pope Francis' successor. Here's how long it could take.

item.title: Watch Live: White smoke from conclave signals a new pope is chosen
item.description: White smoke has streamed from the chimney of the Sistine Chapel at the Vatican, signaling that Catholic cardinals in the conclave have chosen a new po...

item.title: Civil rights leaders say acquittals in Tyre Nichols’ death highlight the need for police reform
Here's what the name of a pope signifies
item.description: The pope's name will help indicate what direction he wants to take the church.

item.title: Ukraine labels Russian ceasefire a farce after reports of hundreds of violations
item.description: A three-day truce was called by Vladimir Putin ahead of Russia's World War Two Victory Day celebrations.

item.title: Israel PM 'uncertain' over condition of three Gaza hostages
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu said he knew "with certainty" that 21 hostages were alive but the status of "three more" were unclear.

item.title: Here's a look at food served inside MLB stadiums — including a 26-inch burrito
item.description: Fans spend an average of about $75 on food and drinks at a Major League Baseball game with specialty food a staple at the ballpark.

item.title: Shock as missing South African journalist's decomposed body found
item.description: Human remains, believed to be that of a journalist and his partner, have been found by police.

item.title: US cuts aid to Zambia over 'systematic' medicine theft
item.description: Critical medicines affected by the $50m cuts include Malaria, HIV and TB drugs, the US embassy says.

item.title: Trump administration releases 60,000 more files on RFK assassination
item.description: President Trump ordered the release of files on Sen. Robert F. Kennedy's assassination — with the backing of the senator's son, Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

item.title: Smokey Robinson’s lawyer says rape allegations against him are ‘vile’ and ‘false’
Deadly April rainfall in US South and Midwest was intensified by climate change, scientists say
item.description: Human-caused climate change intensified deadly rainfall in Kentucky, Tennessee, Arkansas and other states in early April and made it more likely to oc...

item.title: Dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters arrested at Columbia University
item.description: The university asked for police help after protesters occupied part of the main library on Wednesday.
